header_summary:
Ethan Heilman introduced slashing covenants as a novel protocol for enforcing Bitcoin transaction rules by penalizing violations through financial disincentives rather than direct prevention, contrasting with traditional methods that use specific opcodes for enforcement. This approach utilizes existing Bitcoin script capabilities and Lamport signatures to verify authenticity without complex cryptographic operations, highlighting its efficiency and compatibility with current infrastructure. Although designed with Bitcoin in mind, the protocol’s implementation could be simplified on Ethereum, suggesting potential for broader blockchain applicability and expansion to dynamic cosigner groups. [More details](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAEM=y+V_jUoupVRBPqwzOQaUVNdJj5uJy3LK9JjD7ixuCYEt-A@mail.gmail.com/T/#u#m1f4795940901d29312dce1a4b763097ea5d9e7a6).

Antoine Poinsot raised concerns about potential duplicate coinbase transactions in the Bitcoin network, proposing the Consensus Cleanup to differentiate future transactions and prevent the re-enablement of BIP30 verification. Poinsot’s proposals include modifications to transaction elements and incorporating a witness commitment to distinguish transactions and support technological advancements like Utreexo nodes, inviting feedback from the mining community for a collective resolution. [Further reading](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/cLJjA4Em1sfbLHBctwsPUvquk8uMGGnXt2zGx7mn_JNu5F-HULjtdsBQjX9VET6MVRhbzJExPRrwNKBeLV1S30uEgCtFiBmMPVuzTFVNxkY=@protonmail.com/T/#u#m3be1f9c3ae1faf45b543116ed9755eb6badcebbf).

The development of a new tool for analyzing Bitcoin Inquisition transactions was highlighted by vostrnad, aiming to facilitate future explorations with improved simplicity and effectiveness. This initiative invites community feedback for potential enhancements, with details available on the project’s website. [Explore here](https://inquisition.observer).

T-bast critiqued and suggested improvements to the unsigned TLV format for Simplified Payment Verification proofs, emphasizing the need for including the outpoint in signed fields to enrich transaction information. Despite concerns over the proposal for mandating inclusion of a hash of the SPV proof in announcements, there's a collaborative spirit from the eclair team towards developing features for enhancing transaction verification and network compatibility. [Read more](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/updates-to-the-gossip-1-75-proposal-post-ln-summit-meeting/1202/3).

today_in_history_posts.summary:

- Standardizing out-of-band fee payments is important for market inclusivity and reducing centralization risks.
- Implementing such a system requires careful design, including secure bounty claim processes for miners.

today_in_history_posts.title: SIGHASH_SINGLE + update_fee Considered Harmful
today_in_history_posts.summary:

- Implementations may reduce risks by phasing out `update_fee` and relying on CPFP for fee adjustments.
- Countermeasures against attackers bypassing penalties include tightening channel policies and adjusting fee rates.
